Description: WHITE PINE COUNTY WILL ACQUIRE LAND AND CONSTRUCT A NEW COUNTY PARK LOCATED OFF OF US 6, US 50 AND US 93 GREAT BASIN BOULEVARD (PARCEL  001 491 67,  001 491 61 AND PART OF PARCEL  001 491 59). AMENITIES WILL INCLUDE MULTIPLE OPEN SPACES WITH GRASS, TREES AND SEATING, A PLAYGROUND WITH SHADE STRUCTURE AND PLAY SURFACE, DOG PARK, 9 HOLE FRISBEE  DISC GOLF COURSE AND MORE.

TO CONTINUE SERVING THE COMMUNITY AND VISITORS BY PROVIDING SAFE, RELIABLE, CLEAN, LOW MAINTENANCE, EASE OF USE FACILITIES FOR TRADITIONAL AND FUTURE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES, WHITE PINE COUNTY WILL CONSTRUCT AN ALL WEATHER EVENT CENTER, AND UPGRADE, REPLACE OR REFURBISH INFRASTRUCTURE AT THE WHITE PINE COUNTY FAIRGROUNDS LOCATED IN ELY, NEVADA. UPGRADES INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING  UPGRADE GRANDSTANDS TO ALL WEATHER MATERIAL AND CONDUCT STRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS BASED ON ENGINEERING RECOMMENDATIONS CONSTRUCT A NEW OR REMODEL CURRENT CONCESSION KITCHEN AREA BASED ON ENGINEERING RECOMMENDATIONS AND AVAILABLE SPACE TO ACCOMMODATE STATE REGULATIONS CONSTRUCT PAY PER USE SHOWER FACILITY WITHIN THE VICINITY OF THE CURRENT RESTROOM FACILITY REPLACE RACETRACK RAILING ON THE CURRENT  MILE HORSE RACING TRACK INSTALL ONE VAULTED RESTROOM WITHIN THE INFIELD AREA AT THE ARENA INSTALL PAY PER USE LIGHT EMITTING DIODE (LED) LIGHTING IN THE NORTH ARENA UPGRADE LIGHTING IN SOUTH ARENA TO PAY PER USE LED LIGHTING INSTALL MULTIPLE RV ELECTRICAL HOOK UPS WITHIN THE ARENA RACETRACK INFIELD, DEPENDING ON ENGINEERING RESULTS. CONSTRUCT AN ALL WEATHER EVENTS CENTER UP TO APPROXIMATELY 96,000 FT.2, (2.2 ACRES) DEPENDING ON PLANNING AND ENGINEERING UPGRADE POWER SUPPLY FROM V PHASE PRIMARY TO III PHASE PRIMARY AT THE UPPER SECTION OF THE FAIRGROUNDS TO ACCOMMODATE THE EVENT CENTER AND EXISTING FACILITIES REPLACE 3 5 OVERNIGHT BARNS IN UPPER FAIRGROUNDS DEPENDING ON ENGINEERING AND SPACE RECOMMENDATIONS CONSTRUCT COVERED OUTDOOR OVERFLOW HOLDING CORRALS (APPROXIMATELY 150 FT. X 12 FT.) CONSTRUCT STORAGE BUILDING FOR HORSE RACE STARTING GATE (APPROXIMATELY 30 FT. X 30 FT.) CONSTRUCT WALKING TRAIL WITH BENCHES FROM UPPER FAIRGROUNDS TO SOUTH PARK AREA INSTALL SIGNAGE DIRECTING PEDESTRIANS FROM UPPER FAIRGROUNDS TO SOUTH PARK AREA INSTALL LIGHTING AT VOLLEYBALL AND HORSESHOE PIT AREA AT SOUTH PARK INSTALL WATER WITH RV HOOK UPS IF FINAL COST ESTIMATES ALLOW INCLUSION WITHIN THE AMOUNT REQUESTED TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT. CONSTRUCT OUTDOOR LIVESTOCK HOLDING PENS FOR EVENT CENTER IF FINAL COST ESTIMATES ALLOW INCLUSION WITHIN THE AMOUNT REQUESTED TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT.

THIS IS A PROJECT THAT WILL ALLOW WHITE PINE COUNTY, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE NEVADA NORTHERN RAILWAY (NNRY) FOUNDATION, TO PRESERVE A NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK FOR ENJOYMENT AND EDUCATION OF PRESENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS.UPGRADES INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING  REHABILITATE AND RESTORE TO OPERATION HISTORIC RAILROAD TRACK FROM ELY TO MCGILL NEVADA INCLUDING THE HIGHWAY RAILROAD CROSSINGS,COMPLETE THE MCGILL DEPOT RESTORATION TO INCLUDE THREE RESTROOMS, BUILD A PARKING LOT AT THE MCGILL DEPOT, BUILD A RAILROAD TURNTABLE AT THE MCGILL DEPOT, BUILD A LIGHTED WALKING TRAIL WITH OUTDOOR DISPLAYS AT THE MCGILL DEPOT AREA, AND MORE.

THE TRUCKEE MEADOWS FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT WILL IMPLEMENT HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION, DEFENSIBLE SPACE, ECOLOGICAL FUNCTION AND HABITAT IMPROVEMENTS ON 100 TO 200 ACRES OF CITY, COUNTY, AND PRIVATE OWNED LAND ALONG THE MOUNT ROSE CORRIDOR. THIS WILL BE DONE THROUGH  THE REMOVAL OF DEAD BRUSH AND TIMBER, THE THINNING OF LIVE BRUSH AND TIMBER, THE REMOVAL OF LADDER FUELS AND THE RESTORATION OF ASPEN STANDS. ACCESS AND EGRESS ROUTES AND DEFENSIBILITY OF ROADWAYS WILL ALSO BE IMPROVED. IN ADDITION, THE TRUCKEE MEADOWS FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT WILL CONDUCT PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH THROUGH THE PROMOTION OF NEVADA NETWORK OF FIRE ADAPTED COMMUNITIES, LIVING WITH FIRE INITIATIVES AND INVASIVE SPECIES MITIGATION.NICRA OUR ENTITY HAS NEVER HAD A NICRA, HOWEVER, WE WOULD LIKE TO USE 10  AS OUR DE MINIMUS RATE.DUPLICATION OF EFFORT STATEMENT THERE ARE NO OVERLAPS OR DUPLICATION BETWEEN THIS APPLICATION AND ANY OF OUR FEDERAL APPLICATIONS OR FUNDED PROJECTS.

NORTH TAHOE FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT WILL REDUCE HAZARDOUS FUELS ON AT LEAST 300 ACRES, BUT NOT MORE THAN 700 ACRES OF HIGHEST PRIORITY WUI DEFENSE ZONE AREAS WITHIN NORTH TAHOE AND MEEKS BAY FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICTS AS IDENTIFIED IN THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN COMMUNITY WILDFIRE PROTECTION PLAN. THESE TREATMENTS WILL IMPROVE FOREST HEALTH AND REDUCE THE THREAT OF CATASTROPHIC WILDFIRE, PROTECTING LIFE, PROPERTY, AND CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE IN THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN.THE LAND IDENTIFIED FOR TREATMENT INCLUDES LAND OWNED AND MANAGED BY THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA, COUNTIES, LOCAL JURISDICTIONS, AND BOTH SMALL AND LARGE PRIVATE LANDOWNERS. THE PROJECT AREA WAS DEVELOPED USING BOTH THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN COMMUNITY WILDFIRE PROTECTION PLAN (CWPP) AND THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN MULTI JURISDICTIONAL FUEL REDUCTION AND WILDFIRE PREVENTION STRATEGY (MULTI JURISDICTIONAL STRATEGY). THE FINAL TREATMENT AREAS, SELECTED FROM THE PROJECT AREA, WILL BE THE HIGHEST PRIORITIES AS IDENTIFIED IN THE ABOVE MENTIONED PLANS AND ENDORSED THROUGH THE TAHOE FIRE AND FUELS TEAM (TFFT), A VOLUNTARY ASSOCIATION OF BASIN FIRE AGENCIES, LAND MANAGERS, AND REGULATORS.IN ADDITION TO  FURTHERING LAKE TAHOE BASIN FUEL REDUCTION GOALS, ADDRESSING THE SERIOUS THREAT OF CATASTROPHIC WILDFIRE, AND RESPONDING TO THE UNPRECEDENTED NUMBER, SIZE AND  DESTRUCTION CAUSED BY WILDFIRES  THIS PROJECT ALSO PROMOTES THREE SOUTHERN NEVADA PUBLIC LAND MANAGEMENT ACT (SNPLMA) STRATEGIC PLAN GOALS THE PROJECT PROMOTES CONNECTIVITY BY BUILDING UPON A REGIONAL APPROACH TO TREAT PRIORITY AREAS IDENTIFIED IN THE CWPP AND ALSO LINKING PREVIOUSLY TREATED AREAS IDENTIFIED IN THE MULTI JURISDICTIONAL STRATEGY. THUS, BUILDING ON THE SUCCESS OF THE TFFT IN DELIVERING COLLABORATIVELY DEVELOPED AND PRIORITIZED WILDFIRE PREVENTION AND FUEL HAZARD REDUCTION PROGRAMS. THIS PROJECT UNITES DIVERSE OWNERSHIPS TO CONNECT FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL AND PRIVATE FUELS REDUCTION TREATMENTS, AS WELL AS ESTABLISHES BUFFERS AROUND CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE TO ENSURE ADEQUATE FIRE SUPPRESSION CAPABILITY, SUCH AS WATERY DELIVERY AND STORAGE.THE PROJECT PROMOTES COMMUNITY BY PROTECTING PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY, AND BY PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES THAT STRENGTHEN COMMUNICATION AND SUPPORT BETWEEN AGENCIES AND THE PUBLIC. IT WILL HELP CREATE RESILIENT FIRE ADAPTED COMMUNITIES THAT CAN WITHSTAND A WILDFIRE WITHOUT LOSS OF LIFE OR PROPERTY.THE PROJECT TIMEFRAME IS SIX YEARS. NTFPD WILL INITIATE IMPLEMENTATION WITHIN ONE YEAR, CONDUCT THE MAJORITY OF IMPLEMENTATION WITHIN THE FIRST FIVE YEARS, AND WILL FINALIZE IMPLEMENTATION IN YEAR SIX FOR ANY REMAINING BIOMASS DISPOSAL NEEDS (PRESCRIBED BURNING, TRANSPORTING BIOMASS).TREATMENTS PROPOSED IN THIS PROJECT WILL OCCUR ON FORESTED PARCELS OWNED AND MANAGED BY THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA, COUNTIES, LOCAL JURISDICTIONS, AND BOTH SMALL AND LARGE PRIVATE LANDOWNERS. ALL PARCELS IDENTIFIED FOR TREATMENT ARE OF THE HIGHEST PRIORITY WUI DEFENSE ZONE TREATMENTS AS IDENTIFIED IN THE CWPP AND STRATEGY.WITH REGARDS TO SNPLMA R18 NT06, NORTH TAHOE FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT HAS NO OVERLAPS OR DUPLICATION BETWEEN THIS APPLICATION AND ANY OF OUR FEDERAL APPLICATIONS OR FUNDED PROJECTS, INCLUDING IN REGARDS TO ACTIVITIES, COSTS, OR TIME COMMITMENT OF KEY PERSONNEL.I CERTIFY THAT NORTH TAHOE FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT ELECTS TO USE TO 10  DE MINIMIS RATE AND MEETS THE FOLLOWING ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA TO USE THE 10   DE MINIMIS INDIRECT COST RATE 1.THE AWARD RECIPIENT HAS NEVER RECEIVED A FEDERALLY NEGOTIATED INDIRECT COST RATE FOR ANY FEDERAL AWARDS.2.THE PROJECT COSTS WILL BE CONSISTENTLY CHARGED AS EITHER INDIRECT OR DIRECT AND WILL NOT BE DOUBLE CHARGED OR INCONSISTENTLY CHARGED AS BOTH.3.THE PROPER USE AND APPLICATION OF THE DE MINIMIS RATE IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE AWARD RECIPIENT. THE AWARDING FEDERAL AGENCY MAY PERFORM A FINANCIAL MONITORING REVIEW TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH 2 CFR PART 200.

CARSON CITY FIRE DEPT. WILL COLLECT AN ANTICIPATED 1,000 TONS OF BIOMASS OVER 6 YEARS FROM THE DEFENSE ZONE ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF CARSON CITY. FUNDS WILL BE USED TO DELIVER  PICK UP AND DUMP COLLECTION BINS USED BY HOMEOWNERS TO CREATE DEFENSIBLE  SURVIVABLE SPACE. BY REDUCING THE AMOUNT OF FUEL WITHIN THE COMMUNITIES, WE ARE REDUCING IGNITION SOURCES, REDUCING FIRE INTENSITIES AND FLAME LENGTHS, ALL WHILE FOSTERING A HEALTHY AND RESILIENT ECOSYSTEM. THIS IS A STAND ALONE PROJECT AND HAS NO OTHER FEDERAL FUNDING SOURCE.

CARSON CITY FIRE DEPT. WILL TREAT 850 ACRES IN THE WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE SURROUNDING CARSON CITY, NEVADA TO REDUCE HAZARDOUS FUELS ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF CARSON CITY, TO PROTECT COMMUNITIES VULNERABLE TO CATASTROPHIC LOSS IN THE EVENT OF A WILDFIRE.

THE TAHOE RESOURCE CONSERVATION DISTRICT (TAHOE RCD) WILL WORK WITH TAHOE BASIN FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT PARTNERS TO DELIVER A COORDINATED LAKE TAHOE BASIN FIRE ADAPTED COMMUNITIES PROJECT, INCLUDING UP TO 25,000 FIRE DEFENSIBLE SPACE INSPECTIONS AND UP TO 15,000 RESIDENTIAL CHIPPING SERVICES ON PRIVATE PROPERTIES, CORRELATING TO UP TO 2,500 AND 600 ACRES RESPECTIVELY. IN ADDITION, THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE EXTENSIVE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, ASSISTANCE, AND A ROBUST EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PROGRAM WILL BE IMPLEMENTED. MONITORING PROGRESS WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH MAINTAINING COMPREHENSIVE DATABASES TO TRACK AND STREAMLINE REPORTING AND EFFECTIVENESS OF FIRE PREVENTION ACTIVITIES.THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN INCREASED WILDFIRE PREVENTION AND PREPAREDNESS THROUGH THE COMPLETION OF FIRE DEFENSIBLE SPACE TREATMENTS (REDUCING HAZARDOUS FUELS ON PRIVATE PARCELS) ACROSS 400 TO 2,500 ACRES THROUGH COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE TAHOE NETWORK OF FIRE ADAPTED COMMUNITIES. PRIVATE PARCEL FUELS REDUCTION WILL BE FOCUSED ON COMMUNITIES WHERE FUELS REDUCTION PROJECTS ARE PLANNED IN ADJACENT COMMUNITY FORESTRY PROJECTS. THE TOTAL PROJECT AREA IS WITHIN THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN AND INCLUDES APPROXIMATELY 32,275 PARCELS (1 4 ACRE OR LESS IN SIZE), WITH AN ESTIMATED 4,435 ACRES.DUPLICATION OF EFFORT STATEMENT THIS PROJECT IS NOT AN OVERLAP WITH ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY.

THE TAHOE DOUGLAS FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT FUELS REDUCTION  HWY 50 PROJECT IS A 90 TO 115 ACRE FUELS REDUCTION PROJECT LOCATED IN TWO DISTINCT AREAS ALONG THE NORTHERN SECTION OF US HIGHWAY 50 IN THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN BETWEEN GLENBROOK AND ZEPHYR COVE, NV. THESE AREAS ARE PRONE TO HEAVY VEHICLE TRAFFIC IN THE SUMMER MONTHS AND ARE FORESTED LANDS THAT ARE IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO HOMES. THESE PROJECT AREAS ARE WITHIN THE DEFENSE ZONE IN THE WUI. THE PROJECT IS NECESSARY TO PREVENT IMPACTS TO THE COMMUNITY AND ENVIRONMENT FROM CATASTROPHIC WILDFIRE. THIS TREATMENT WILL HELP TO MODIFY POTENTIAL FIRE BEHAVIOR SUCH THAT FIREFIGHTERS WILL BE ABLE TO SAFELY PROTECT LIFE, PROPERTY, AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM AN APPROACHING WILDLAND FIRE. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO DRASTICALLY INCREASE THE SUSTAIN ABILITY OF THE ECOSYSTEMS BY RETURNING THE ENVIRONMENT BACK TO A MORE  NATURAL  LANDSCAPE IN TERMS OF VEGETATION, TREE DENSITY, AND SPECIES COMPOSITION. TREATMENT WILL INCLUDE THINNING AND REMOVAL OF FUELS WITHIN THE PROJECT AREAS AND IS EXPECTED TO COMMENCE IN 2023 AND WILL BE COMPLETED BY 2028.DE MINIMUS RATE STATEMENT THE TAHOE DOUGLAS FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT HAS NEVER HAD A NEGOTIATED INDIRECT RATE AGREEMENT (NICRA), HOWEVER, WE WOULD LIKE TO USE 10  AS OUR DE MINIMUS RATE.DUPLICATION OF EFFORT STATEMENT THE TAHOE DOUGLAS FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT IS CONFIDENT IN STATING THAT THE HWY 50 FUELS REDUCTION PROJECT DOES NOT OVERLAP WITH ANY ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES PROJECT AND OR FUNDING.

SOUTH LAKE TAHOE FIRE RESCUE (SLTFR) VIEWS FUEL REDUCTION IN THE TAHOE BASIN AS TOP PRIORITY FOR PUBLIC SAFETY, AND THE ENVIRONMENT IN PREVENTING THE DESTRUCTION CAUSED BY A CATASTROPHIC WILDFIRE. SLTFR OF THE CITY OF SOUTH LAKE TAHOE WILL REDUCE APPROXIMATELY 149.82 ACRES OF HAZARDOUS FUELS AT THREE CITY OWNED PROPERTIES TO REDUCE THE SEVERITY OF WILDFIRE BEHAVIOR, IMPROVE DEFENSIBLE SPACE PROTECTION TO ADJOINING PRIVATE LANDS, AND ENHANCE FOREST ECOSYSTEM HEALTH. THREE LOCATIONS SELECTED FROM THE COMMUNITY WILDFIRE PROTECTION PLAN (CWPP) AND ENDORSED BY THE TAHOE FIRE AND FUELS TEAM (TFFT) INCLUDE  LAKE TAHOE AIRPORT, TAHOE VISTA NEIGHBORHOOD, AND CITY OF SOUTH LAKE TAHOE CAMPGROUND. THESE CITY OWNED PROPERTIES ARE DEEMED PRIORITY IN THE 2015 LAKE TAHOE BASIN COMMUNITY WILDFIRE PROTECTION PLAN, DESIGNED TO ADDRESS THE IMMEDIATE THREAT ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS POSE TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY. THE PARCELS SELECTED RESIDE IN NEAR THE AIRPORT, SCHOOLS, CRITICAL WATER SHEDS, COMMUNITY CENTERS, EMERGENCY CENTERS, PUBLIC SAFETY INFRASTRUCTURE, AND WATER SUPPLY WELLS. THINNING OF VEGETATION WILL PROVIDE BENEFITS OF HABITAT PROTECTION BY PROMOTING GROWTH OF LARGER TREES, REDUCING RESOURCE COMPETITION AND CREATE LARGER MORE RESILIENT FOREST STANDS PROVIDING LONG TERM CARBON SEQUESTRATION. AN ADDED CO BENEFIT OF INCREASED TREE VIGOR AND FOREST HEALTH IS ITS ABILITY TO WITHSTAND FIRE, PESTS, AND PATHOGENS AS WELL AS CLIMATE CHANGE. RESTORING THE PROJECT SITES TO HEALTHY FOREST CONDITIONS IS AN INTEGRAL COMPONENT TO REDUCE THE EFFECTS OF FIRE WITHIN THE WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE. PLEASE NOTE  THE CITY OF SOUTH LAKE TAHOE DOES NOT HAVE AN APPROVED COST ALLOCATION PLAN AND WILL NOT CHARGE IN DIRECT COSTS TO THE PROJECT. IN ADDITION THERE IS NO DUPLICATION OF EFFORT WITH ANY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCY REGARDING THE FUEL REDUCTION EFFORTS PROPOSED ON THE PARCELS IN THIS APPLICATION.

THE NORTH LAKE TAHOE FIRE PROTECTION DISTRICT  NLTFPD  WILL REDUCE HAZARDOUS FUELS ON 210-620 ACRES AND PLAN FOR ADDITIONAL HAZARDOUS FUELS REMOVAL ON NON-FEDERAL LANDS IN THE WILDLAND-URBAN INTERFACE OF INCLINE VILLAGE AND CRYSTAL BAY, NV TO MITIGATE THE WILDFIRE RISK TO THE COMMUNITY AND IMPROVE FOREST HEALTH. THE PROJECT WILL BE ACCOMPANIED BY TWO PUBLIC OUTREACH ACTIVITIES THAT WILL SHOWCASE FUELS REDUCTION TREATMENTS AND PROVIDE EDUCATION ON FOREST HEALTH, FUELS TREATMENTS, AND FIRE ADAPTED COMMUNITY CONCEPTS. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL CREATE A BETTER INFORMED AND MORE PREPARED FIRE ADAPTED COMMUNITY IN INCLINE VILLAGE AND CRYSTAL BAY, NV, AN AREA OF EXTREME WILDFIRE RISK.INDIRECT COSTS NORTH LAKE TAHOE FIRE PROTECTION WILL UTILIZE DE MINIMUS OF 10  FOR ALL INDIRECT COSTS BASED ON TOTAL MODIFIED DIRECT COSTS  MTDC . NLTFPD HAS NEVER REQUESTED A NEGOTIATED INDIRECT COST RATE AGREEMENT  NICRA  WITH ANY COGNIZANT AGENCY AND THEREFORE THE DE MINIMUS RATE IS APPLICABLE FOR FEDERAL ASSISTANT GRANTS BASED ON 2CFR200.DUPLICATION OF EFFORTS STATEMENT THIS PROJECT IS NOT PART OF, NOR DOES IT OVER-LAP WITH ANY OTHER FEDERALLY OR NON-FEDERALLY FUNDED FUELS REDUCTION PROJECTS.

LINCOLN COUNTY WILL DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT IMPROVEMENTS TO PIONEER PARK LOCATED IN THE TOWN OF PANACA IN LINCOLN COUNTY, NEVADA. IMPROVEMENTS WILL INCLUDE PARK EXPANSION FOR AN ADDITIONAL PLAYING FIELD, ADA ACCESSIBLE WALKWAYS AND PLAYGROUND AREA. THIS IS THE ONLY MULTI-USE PARK IN TOWN. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AN ENHANCED AND SAFE OUTDOOR EXPERIENCE FOR THOSE WHO FREQUENT AND USE THE PARK. PRIMARY DELIVERABLES  RELOCATION OF UTILITIES  OVERHEAD POWER LINE AND UNDERGROUND COMMUNICATION LINES  INSTALL DRAINAGE SYSTEM INSTALLATION 12 FT. FENCING BEHIND HOMEPLATE  80 FEET LONG  INSTALLATION 6 FT. FENCING ALONG EAST OF FIRST BASELINE  100 FEET LONG  INSTALLATION 4 FT. FENCING EAST LINE OF GRASS AREA AND RETAINING WALL  420 FEET LONG  CONSTRUCTION OF A CONCRETE RETAINING WALL  300 FEET LONG X 6 FEET HIGH  CONSTRUCTION OF CONCRETE SIDEWALK AND FLATWORK  18,000 SF  INSTALL TURF GRASS AND IRRIGATION SYSTEMS CONSTRUCTION OF A PARKING LOT TO ACCOMMODATE 50-60 VEHICLES  30,000 SF  CONSTRUCT AN ADDITIONAL PRACTICE INFIELD  5,000 SF  7 PICNIC TABLES DIAMOND DIRT WORK INSTALLATION OF RUBBER SURFACE FOR PLAYGROUND  APPROX 2,200 SF  WALKWAY LIGHTING ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE  NONE STAND DELIVERABLES  RELOCATION ASSESSMENT TO DETERMINE APPLICABILITY OF UNIFORM RELOCATION ACT ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT CONSISTENT WITH THE NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY ACT SECTION 106 COMPLIANCE PUBLIC AND AGENCY SCOPING COORDINATION AMONG DESIGN TEAM AND TOWN BOARD PLAN AND DESIGN KIOSK CONTENTS CONSTRUCTION AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT NICRA - NOT APPLICABLE DUPLICATION OF EFFORT STATEMENT - THIS PROJECT DOES NOT HAVE FUNDING FROM ANY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCY

CARSON CITY WILL ACQUIRE THE QUANTITY OF STREAM WATER RIGHTS  NO MORE THAN 694.35-ACRE-FEET-ANNUALLY  NECESSARY TO SUSTAIN BENEFICIAL USE OF THE 148.48 ACRES OF WETLAND AND WET MEADOW HABITAT ON CARSON CITY S PROPERTY  BUZZY S RANCH  LOCATED ADJACENT TO THE CARSON RIVER IN CARSON CITY, NEVADA. ACQUISITION OF THE WATER RIGHTS WILL ENHANCE AN EXISTING NATURAL AREA  WETLAND AND WET MEADOW  ON THE PROPERTY BY PROVIDING A PERMANENT AND DEDICATED WATER SOURCE TO SUSTAIN THE HABITAT AND PRESERVE THE AESTHETIC VALUE OF THE PROPERTY THROUGH SCENIC VIEWSHEDS FOR RECREATIONAL AND PUBLIC ENJOYMENT. DUPLICATION OF EFFORT STATEMENT  THERE IS NO DUPLICATION OF EFFORT, THIS PROJECT DOES NOT OVERLAP WITH ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY. NICRA STATEMENT  CARSON CITY HAS NEVER HAD A NICRA, HOWEVER, WE WOULD LIKE TO USE 10  AS OUR DE MINIMUS RATE

CLARK COUNTY WILL DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT TWO (2) BASEBALL SOFTBALL FIELDS WITH DIRT INFIELDS AND ASSOCIATED AMENITIES AND PLAYGROUND AT THE LOGANDALE SPORTS COMPLEX, TO PROVIDE CONNECTIVITY TO A PREVIOUSLY FUNDED SNPLMA PROJECT, THE MOAPA VALLEY TRAILS PHASE 1 COMPLETED IN ROUND 6. THE PROJECT WOULD ADD TWO BALL FIELDS, A PLAYGROUND AND OTHER FEATURES MAKING IT A COMPLETE 4 PLEX, AND WOULD INCREASE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AND ALLOW MORE SPACE TO PRACTICE AND HOLD TOURNAMENTS.

CLARK COUNTY WILL DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT A TEN (10) FOOT WIDE ASPHALT WALKING TRAIL UP TO ONE (1) HALF MILE IN LENGTH WITHIN THE EXISTING INDIAN SPRINGS PARK AND NEW RECREATIONAL AMENITIES INCLUDING A NATURE PLAY AREA WITH SHADE SCREENING, SHADE SCREENING OVER EXISTING PLAYGROUND AMENITIES, A MEDIUM SIZED COVERED PAVILION WITH PICNIC TABLES, BARBEQUE AND TRASH ENCLOSURES, INTERPRETIVE EDUCATIONAL PANELS AND LANDSCAPING AND SHADE TREES ADJACENT TO NEW FACILITIES. THE MAIN GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO PROVIDE A SAFE OFF STREET TRAIL FOR PARK USERS TO WALK AND JOG WHILE THEIR CHILDREN PLAY IN THE PARK, HELP CHILDREN AND ADULTS EXPERIENCE THE OUTDOOR NATURAL ENVIRONMENT THROUGH NATURE THEMED PLAY ACTIVITIES AND EXPAND THE SYSTEM OF PARKS TRAILS IN THE LAS VEGAS VALLEY.

THIS PROPOSED PROJECT, WHEN FULLY COMPLETED, WILL ADD CRITICAL AMENITIES THAT WILL ALLOW THE SPORTS COMPLEX TO REESTABLISH ITSELF AS THIS CENTER FOR THE COMMUNITY TO GATHER, FOCUSING ON HEALTH, WELLNESS AND OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES. SPECIFICALLY, THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE CONSTRUCTION OF A SPLASH PARK THAT CELEBRATES THE HISTORICAL ASPECT OF THE CITY S ORIGINAL HYDROTUBE ALONG WITH MULTIPLE PLAY AREAS WITH SAFETY SURFACING ENCOMPASSING ACTIVE PLAY CONCEPTS FOR A VARIETY OF AGE GROUPS FROM TODDLERS TO SENIORS. ADDITIONALLY, ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE COMMUNITY S HEALTH AND FITNESS NEEDS BY ENHANCING THE CURRENT WALKING TRACK BY IMPROVING THE SURFACING, ADDING A FITNESS CIRCUIT WITH MULTIPLE STATIONS TO TARGET STRENGTH AND CONDITIONING, AND INSTALLING ADDITIONAL EFFICIENT LIGHTING SO THAT THE TRACK CAN BE USED IN THE EVENINGS TO AVOID THE SUMMER HEAT. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO ALLOW FOR CONNECTIVITY BETWEEN THE VARIOUS ACTIVE AND PASSIVE AREAS OF THE PARK AND WILL IMPROVE THE PARKING AREAS, THEREBY MAKING IT SAFE AND ACCESSIBLE FOR ALL.

THE CITY OF NORTH LAS VEGAS IS PROPOSING TO EXTEND THE MULTI USE BELTWAY TRAIL FROM DECATUR BOULEVARD TO NORTH 5TH STREET WHICH WILL INCLUDE CONSTRUCTING APPROXIMATELY 4.5 MILES OF ASPHALT TRAIL WITH LIGHTING, INTERPRETATIVE SIGNAGE, WAYFINDING SIGNAGE, REGULATORY SIGNAGE, BENCHES AND LANDSCAPED WITH NATIVE VEGETATION DROUGHT TOLERANT PLANTS. THIS EXTENSION WILL BE THE FIRST COMPONENT OF THE REGIONAL TRAIL CONSTRUCTED WITHIN THE CITY. THE NORTHERN PORTION OF THE BELTWAY TRAIL WILL FOLLOW THE BRUCE WOODBURY BELTWAY EAST, OFFERING EXCEPTIONAL VIEWS OF THE SHEEP MOUNTAINS THAT FLANK THE CITY. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE INTERPRETIVE EDUCATION SIGNAGE HIGHLIGHTING THE SHEEP RANGE, DESERT NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE AND THE TULE SPRINGS FOSSIL BEDS NATIONAL MONUMENT. THE URBAN TRAIL WILL PROVIDE A CONVENIENT ACTIVE TRANSPORTATION ROUTE FOR COMMUTERS, AS WELL AS A RECREATIONAL ESCAPE. ACTIVE TRANSPORTATION IS DEFINED AS HUMAN POWERED MODES OF TRANSPORTATION, PRIMARILY WALKING AND BICYCLING.

THE DEVELOPMENT OF KIEL RANCH HISTORIC PARK PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE COMMUNITY TO EXPLORE AND LEARN ABOUT THE SITE S HISTORY AND NATURAL RESOURCES. THROUGH RECREATIONAL ENGAGEMENT THE AUDIENCE CAN BE INTELLECTUALLY AND RESPONSIVELY CONNECTED TO THE SITE BY HIGHLIGHTING WHAT MADE THIS LOCATION AN ATTRACTIVE PLACE TO SETTLE AND RANCH. FOR THE KIEL RANCH HISTORIC PARK FAMILY MESA PROJECT LOCATED AT 2465 KIEL WAY (APN 139 15 801 017), THE CITY OF NORTH LAS VEGAS WILL DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT APPROXIMATELY 7 ACRES OF THE HISTORICAL PARK WITH COMMUNITY AMENITIES THAT WILL INTEGRATE LEARNING AND PLAY. THIS WILL INCLUDE EDUCATIONAL PLAY STRUCTURES  AREAS FOR OBSERVATION AND REFLECTION  TACTILE OBJECTS ON PANELS  PUBLIC ART  INTERPRETIVE GAMES  PICNIC FACILITIES  LANDSCAPING  RESTROOMS AND ENTRY FEATURES. THE PARK WILL SERVE THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY THAT IS ECONOMICALLY CHALLENGED  THE CITY WHICH HAS A MINORITY MAJORITY POPULATION  AND VISITORS FROM ACROSS THE LAS VEGAS VALLEY.

THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS WILL DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT A 30 COURT REGIONAL PICKLEBALL COMPLEX ON 5.43 ACRES SOUTH OF WAYNE BUNKER PARK TO SERVE THE GROWING NUMBER OF PICKLEBALL PLAYERS IN THE VALLEY WHO HAVE DIFFICULTY FINDING PLACES TO PLAY PICKLEBALL AND TO HOST LOCAL, REGIONAL, STATE, NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL TOURNAMENTS.THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS IS NOT CLAIMING ANY INDIRECT COSTSKATIE SEARS IS SERVING AS THE PI AND ADODUPLICATION OF EFFORTS STATEMENT  THIS PROJECT IS NOT AN OVERLAP WITH ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY. THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS IS MOT RECEIVING ANY OTHER FEDERAL FUNDS FROM ANY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCY FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS WILL DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT A REGIONAL OUTDOOR OLYMPIC SIZED SWIMMING POOL NORTH OF THE INDOOR POOL AT SOUTH PAVILION CENTER DRIVE IN THE WEST PART OF THE LAS VEGAS VALLEY IN CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA. THIS PROJECT WILL OFFER LOCAL, REGIONAL, STATE, NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL SWIM MEETS ALONG WITH VIRAL LEARN TO SWIM, LIFEGUARDING AND OTHER AQUATIC PROGRAMS TO SERVE THE GROWING NUMBER OF COMPETITIVE AND RECREATIONAL SWIMMERS IN THE VALLEY.THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS IS NOT CLAIMING ANY INDIRECT COSTSKATIE SEARS IS SERVING AS THE PI AND ADODUPLICATION OF EFFORTS STATEMENT  THIS PROJECT IS NOT AN OVERLAP WITH ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY. THE CITY OF LAS VEGAS IS MOT RECEIVING ANY OTHER FEDERAL FUNDS FROM ANY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCY FOR THIS PROJECT.

THE SOUTHERN NEVADA WATER AUTHORITY  SNWA  PLANS TO EXTEND THE WARM SPRINGS NATURAL AREA S  WSNA  TRAILHEAD BY APPROXIMATELY 0.60 MILES TO DIRECTLY CONNECT IT TO THE ENTRANCE OF THE MOAPA VALLEY NATIONAL WILDLIFE REFUGE. THIS INTERFACE WILL PROVIDE VISITOR CONNECTIVITY BETWEEN THE TWO SITES AND EXPAND OUTDOOR RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES. MOREOVER, THE SNWA WILL CONDUCT A TRAFFIC STUDY AND INSTALL APPROPRIATE TRAFFIC APPURTENANCES TO PROVIDE SAFE PEDESTRIAN CROSSING OF WARM SPRINGS ROAD. THE CONNECTION BETWEEN THE WSNA AND THE REFUGE WILL ALLOW FOR INTERPRETATIVE MESSAGING ABOUT THE SHARED MANAGEMENT GOAL OF BOTH SITES  TO PROTECT SENSITIVE ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES.

THE PROJECT EXEMPLIFIES THE REGIONAL CONTEXT OF NATURAL OPEN SPACE AND ITS VALUE IN AN OVERALL COMMUNITY PLAN FOR RECREATION, NATURE STUDY INTERPRETATION, TRAIL LINKAGE, AND ENVIRONMENTAL PRESERVATION. THE SITE IS OWNED BY THE CITY OF HENDERSON AND IS LOCATED AT THE NORTHERN END OF THE MCCULLOUGH RANGE, SOUTH AND WEST OF HORIZON RIDGE PKWY. THE PROJECT AREA COVERS APPROXIMATELY 1,300 ACRES AND CONSISTS PRIMARILY OF VOLCANIC ROCK OF TERTIARY ORIGIN.THE PROJECT CONSISTS OF SCENIC TRAILS, A TRAILHEAD, SCENIC OVERLOOKS, INTERPRETIVE LOCATIONS, A RESTROOM BUILDING, AND A SOLAR POWERED PARKING AREA FOR BUSES AND VEHICLES. THE INTERPRETIVE LOCATIONS WILL CREATE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AND DESTINATIONS FOR ALL AGES. THE NATURE PRESERVE WILL CONNECT TO THE SLOAN CANYON NATIONAL CONSERVATION AREA VIA THE MCCULLOUGH HILLS TRAIL. DISTINGUISHING BLACK MOUNTAIN AS A NATURE PRESERVE WILL ENSURE THAT FUTURE GENERATIONS OF SOUTHERN NEVADANS CAN EXPERIENCE THE UNIQUE GEOLOGICAL FEATURES AND SENSITIVE SPECIES IN THE AREA.PURPOSELY LOW IMPACT, THE PROJECT WOULD PROTECT SENSITIVE FLORA AND FAUNA PROTECTED UNDER STATE LAW, ENSURING THE SPECIES WILL FLOURISH FOR YEARS TO COME. THERE IS AN INTEREST IN THIS AREA FOR MORE ADVENTUROUS ACTIVITIES AND IF THE PROJECT PERMITS, IT COULD INCLUDE A ZIP LINE AND OR A ROPES COURSE. IT IS EVIDENT THROUGH COMMUNITY SURVEYS  THE PUBLIC ENJOYS BEING OUTDOORS AND BEING ABLE TO EXPERIENCE A VARIETY OF ACTIVITIES.THE CITY OF HENDERSON DOES NOT HAVE A NEGOTIATE INDIRECT RATE.THE BLACK MOUNTAIN NATURE PRESERVE SUBMITTED AND APPROVED FOR ROUND 18 FUNDING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN NEVADA PUBLIC LAND MANAGEMENT ACT (SNPLMA) AND THE AWARD AMOUNT IS  5,608,540.00. THE CITY OF HENDERSON SUBMITTED A PROJECT FOR A GRANT BEFORE THE AWARD FUNDING WAS ANNOUNCED FOR THE SUMMIT TRAIL THROUGH THE NEVADA RECREATIONAL TRAILS PROGRAM 2022 GRANTS WHICH IS FUNDED THROUGH THE FEDERAL HIGHWAY ADMINISTRATION. THE GRANT REQUEST WAS IN THE AMOUNT OF  17,809.00 FOR UP TO 0.75 MILE TRAIL SEGMENT IN THE SOUTHEASTERN CORNER OF THE PROJECT SITE.

THE CENTER WILL BE LOCATED NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF RUSSELL ROAD AND STEPHANIE STREET, WITH EASY ACCESS TO INTERSTATE 515. THE PROJECT WILL BE APPROXIMATELY 10,000 SQUARE FEET AND WILL PROVIDE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE LAS VEGAS VALLEY RESIDENTS AND VISITORS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS. RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES PROVIDED WITHIN THIS FACILITY WILL BENEFIT BOTH DISABLED AND ABLE BODIED INDIVIDUALS. WHILE THE FACILITIES WILL BE ADA ACCESSIBLE, IT WILL BE OPEN TO ALL AGES AND ABILITIES TO ENCOURAGE PARTICIPANTS TO ACTIVELY INTEGRATE AND APPRECIATE EVERYONE. THE BROAD RANGE OF SPORTS AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES PROGRAMMED FOR THE CENTER WILL ENABLE ENDLESS OPPORTUNITIES, NEW STRENGTHS AND BUILD CONFIDENCE.IN THE PREVIOUS SNPLMA ROUND 17 APPLICATION PROCESS, THE ADAPTIVE USE PARK HOME FIELD FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS WAS APPROVED FOR FUNDING. THE THERAPEUTIC RECREATION AND INCLUSION CENTER WILL COMPLEMENT THE FUTURE ADAPTIVE USE PARK HOME FIELD AND EXPAND UPON THE SERVICES FOR DISABLED INDIVIDUALS. CURRENTLY, THE SPECIAL NEEDS COMMUNITY IS VASTLY UNDERSERVED IN THE LAS VEGAS VALLEY. THE THERAPEUTIC RECREATION AND INCLUSION CENTER WILL CREATE A SYNERGY BETWEEN INDOOR AND OUTDOOR RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE COMMUNITY, ENRICHING LIVES AND OFFERING TRANSFORMATIVE EXPERIENCES.THE CITY OF HENDERSON DOES NOT HAVE A NEGOTIATE INDIRECT RATE.THE THERAPEUTIC RECREATION AND  INCLUSION CENTER SUBMITTED AND APPROVED FOR ROUND 18 FUNDING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN NEVADA PUBLIC LAND MANAGEMENT ACT (SNPLMA) WILL NOT HAVE OVERLAP OF FUNDING FROM ANY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES. THE AWARD AMOUNT IS  4,666,460.00. HOWEVER, THE PROJECT WILL BE LOCATED AT THE SITE OF ROUND 17, ADAPTIVE USE PARK HN44, AND THE CITY WOULD LIKE TO DISCUSS EFFORTS TO ELIMINATE DUPLICATIONS OF DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION WORK TO PROVIDE COST AND TIME SAVINGS FOR BOTH PROJECTS. WE WOULD LIKE TO HAVE THE INFRASTRUCTURE FOR HN47 BE INCORPORATED INTO HN44. THIS WOULD ALLOW DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION TO MINIMIZE DISRUPTION OF SITE WORK BETWEEN THE TWO PROJECTS. IT WOULD REDUCE DEMOLITION OF THE NEWLY CONSTRUCTED PARK ELEMENTS OF HN44, LIKE PARKING LOT AND SIDEWALKS, FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF UTILITIES FOR HN47 TO OCCUR FOR THE NEW BUILDING.

SOUTHWEST RIDGE BICYCLE SKILLS PARK WILL BE DIVIDED INTO A VARIETY OF SKILLS, COURSES AND TRACKS AND WILL HAVE AN ENTRY PLAZA, PARKING LOT, GATHERING SPACE, PREFABRICATED RESTROOM, SHADE STRUCTURE, TREES AND FLAT TOP BOULDERS TO CREATE TO CREATE NATURAL SEATING AND GATHERING AREAS. THE MAIN GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO PROVIDE A SAFE AND CONTROLLED ENVIRONMENT FOR BIKE USERS OF ALL LEVELS AND EXPERIENCE TO LEARN AND HONE BIKING SKILLS, EXPERIENCE THE OUTDOOR NATURAL ENVIRONMENT THROUGH BIKING ACTIVITIES  AND GENERALLY EXPAND THE SYSTEM OF PARKS TRAILS IN CLARK COUNTY.

LINCOLN COUNTY WILL CONSTRUCT A 4-MILE TRAIL AND TRAILHEAD REFERRED AS SLAUGHTERHOUSE TRAIL WITHIN 415 ACRES OF BLM PUBLIC LANDS IDENTIFIED FOR CONVEYANCE TO THE COUNTY FOR OPEN SPACE. THE CONVEYANCE LANDS AND PROPOSED TRAIL ARE LOCATED SOUTHWEST OF SR321 ADJACENT TO THE TOWN OF PIOCHE, NEVADA. THE TRAIL WILL PROVIDE AN OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL EXPERIENCE IN A NATURAL SETTING JUST MINUTES FROM TOWN. NEW CONSTRUCTION WILL BE MINIMAL AND MUCH OF THE NATURAL SURROUNDING WILL BE PROTECTED. WITH THE DESIGNATION OF THE CONVEYANCE LANDS AS  OPEN SPACE  THE RECREATIONAL EMPHASIS WILL BE HIKING AND BIKING FOR USERS OF ALL AGES TO PURSUE THEIR INTERESTS IN THE OUTDOORS AND PROVIDE AN INTERPRETIVE EMPHASIS ON THE HISTORIC SIGNIFICANCE OF THE LOCAL AREA. PRIMARY DELIVERABLES  1. CONVEYANCE OF ?415 ACRES OF PUBLIC LAND CONSISTENT WITH P.L. 108-424 2. CONSTRUCTION OF A ?4-MILE TRAIL  10-12 FT WIDE  3. TRAILHEAD  ?50FT. X 75FT.  4. DRAINAGE SYSTEM  ?500 FEET  5. FENCING  ?1,350 LINEAR  6. PARKING  ?50 FT. X 75 FT.  7. BOLLARDS  20 EACH  8. PICNIC TABLES  4-8 EACH  9. CAMPGROUNDS  2-4 EACH  10. KIOSK  1 EACH  11. SIGNAGE  1 EACH  ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES  NONE STANDARD DELIVERABLES  EVALUATION OF REAL PROPERTY  E.G., CADASTRAL REVIEW, SITE INSPECTIONS, ESA  NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT  SECTION 106  CONSULTATION ENVIRONMENTAL ANALYSIS PURSUANT TO THE NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY ACT PUBLIC AND AGENCY SCOPING COORDINATION AMONG DESIGN TEAM AND TOWN BOARD PLAN AND DESIGN ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENTS IF NEEDED KIOSK CONTENTS CONSTRUCTION AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT NICRA - NOT APPLICABLE DUPLICATION OF EFFORT STATEMENT  THIS PROJECT DOES NOT HAVE FUNDING FROM ANY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCY.

CARSON CITY WILL DESIGN AND CONSTRUCT A NON-MOTORIZED MULTI-USE TRAIL APPROXIMATELY 2.5 MILES IN LENGTH ALONG THE WEST SIDE OF PRISON HILL AND MAKE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE EXISTING KOONTZ LANE TRAILHEAD IN CARSON CITY, NEVADA. IMPROVEMENTS TO THE TRAILHEAD WILL INCLUDE REGRADING AN ACCESS ROAD AND IMPROVE DRAINAGE, REGRADE AND RESHAPE A PARKING AREA, INSTALL AN ADA ACCESSIBLE SINGLE-VAULT TOILET AND PICNIC TABLE WITH SHADE STRUCTURE. THIS PROJECT WILL CONTINUE AN ONGOING EFFORT TO CREATE A NETWORK OF TRAILS THAT CONNECT NEIGHBORHOODS TO PARKS AND OPEN SPACE LANDS IN THE CARSON RIVER PRISON HILL AREA  ENHANCE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR FAMILIES AND THOSE WITH MOBILITY CHALLENGES  AND IMPROVE VISITOR SAFETY WHILE MAINTAINING CONSERVATION VALUES OF THESE IMPORTANT PROPERTIES. DUPLICATION OF EFFORT STATEMENT  THIS PROJECT IS NOT AN OVERLAP WITH ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY.

THE CLARK COUNTY DESERT CONSERVATION PROGRAM  DCP  PROPOSES TO CARRY OUT RESTORATION OF LINEAR DISTURBANCES IN THE PIUTE-ELDORADO AREA OF CRITICAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERN  ACEC  TO IMPROVE HABITAT CONDITIONS FOR DESERT TORTOISE AND OTHER WILDLIFE IN THE ACEC.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL INCLUDE AN OUTDOOR CLASSROOM AREA AND KITCHEN, PLAYGROUNDS, A SPLASH PAD, TURF, RESTROOMS, EDIBLE LANDSCAPE, AND A SHADED PICNIC AREA. THE PROJECT SITE IS OWNED BY THE CITY OF HENDERSON.THE VALLEY VIEW NEIGHBORHOOD IS AN ECONOMICALLY, ETHNICALLY DIVERSE, AND UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITY WITHIN THE CITY OF HENDERSON. WHEREAS THE CITY HAS A 7.1 PERCENT AFRICAN AMERICAN POPULATION AND 18.9 PERCENT HISPANIC POPULATION, THE VALLEY VIEW NEIGHBORHOOD IS MORE ETHNICALLY DIVERSE, WITH A 9.7 PERCENT AFRICAN AMERICAN POPULATION AND 29.5 PERCENT HISPANIC POPULATION.THE CITY OF HENDERSON HAS A STRATEGIC GOAL TO PROVIDE EVERY RESIDENT WITHIN A 10 MINUTE WALK TO A PARK. THE VALLEY VIEW NEIGHBORHOOD HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED AS AN AREA DEFICIENT IN PARKS AND RECREATIONAL FACILITIES. THE PROJECT WILL HELP ADDRESS THIS ABSENCE BY PROVIDING THE COMMUNITY WITH AN ACCESSIBLE PARK THAT WILL PROVIDE AN ENJOYABLE RECREATIONAL AND EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE. ADDITIONALLY, THE IMPLEMENTATION OF DRAKE STREET PARK WILL HELP WITH ADVANCING SEVERAL CITY OF HENDERSON PLANS, INCLUDING THE DRAKE STREET MASTER PLAN, THE HENDERSON STRONG COMPREHENSIVE PLAN, THE HENDERSON AGE FRIENDLY ACTION PLAN, AND THE 10 MINUTE WALK CAMPAIGN.THE DRAKE STREET PARK PROJECT WILL HAVE A TRANSFORMATIVE AND REVITALIZING IMPACT TO THE VALLEY VIEW NEIGHBORHOOD BY ENGAGING THE COMMUNITY WITH RECREATIONAL AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES, THUS IMPROVING THE LIVELIHOOD AND PHYSICAL WELL BEING IN AN OUTDOOR SETTING.THE CITY OF HENDERSON DOES NOT HAVE A NEGOTIATE INDIRECT RATE.THE DRAKE STREET PARK SUBMITTED AND APPROVED FOR ROUND 18 FUNDING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN NEVADA PUBLIC LAND MANAGEMENT ACT (SNPLMA) WILL NOT HAVE OVERLAP OF FUNDING FROM ANY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES. THE AWARD AMOUNT IS  3,876,394.00.

THE CLARK COUNTY DESERT CONSERVATION PROGRAM  DCP  PROPOSES TO CARRY OUT CONSERVATION ACTIONS AT RAINBOW GARDENS TO RESTORE AND ENHANCE HABITAT FOR SENSITIVE SPECIES AND TO IMPROVE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES WHILE ALSO PROVIDING FOR PROTECTION OF IMPORTANT NATURAL RESOURCES IN THE AREA

THE CALIFORNIA TAHOE CONSERVANCY  CONSERVANCY  AND THE USDA FOREST SERVICE, LAKE TAHOE BASIN MANAGEMENT UNIT  LTBMU  WILL IMPLEMENT A COMPREHENSIVE, COORDINATED MANAGEMENT STRATEGY TO REDUCE HAZARDOUS FUELS IN COMMUNITY FORESTS ON THE CALIFORNIA SIDE OF THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN  BASIN   THE CONSERVANCY AND THE LTBMU WILL REDUCE HAZARDOUS FUELS ON AT LEAST 650 ACRES AND NOT MORE THAN 850 ACRES OF SMALL, FORESTED PARCELS ACROSS PUBLIC AND PRIVATE OWNERSHIPS INTERSPERSED THROUGHOUT NEIGHBORHOODS  THE PROPOSED TREATMENTS ENCOMPASS APPROXIMATELY 2,400 INDIVIDUAL PUBLIC OPEN SPACE LOTS AND UNDEVELOPED PRIVATE LOTS THAT CONNECT TO THE DEFENSIBLE SPACE OF 2,000 HOMES AND OTHER STRUCTURES THE CONSERVANCY ELECTS TO USE THE 10   MTDC  DE MINIMUS RATE DUPLICATION OF EFFORT  THIS PROJECT IS NOT AN OVERLAP WITH FUNDING FROM ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY

THE CALIFORNIA TAHOE CONSERVANCY  CONSERVANCY  WILL REDUCE HAZARDOUS FUELS ON AT LEAST 950 ACRES AND NOT MORE THAN 1,250 ACRES OF THE HIGHEST PRIORITY AREAS  FOCUS AREAS  WITHIN THE DEFENSE ZONE OF THE WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE  WUI  ON THE CALIFORNIA SIDE OF THE LAKE TAHOE BASIN  BASIN   THE THREE FOCUS AREAS ARE SPLIT INTO GEOGRAPHIC REGIONS  NORTH, WEST, AND SOUTH  AND ARE COMPOSED OF CONSERVANCY OWNED LARGE  GREATER THAN 1 ACRE  PARCELS ADJACENT TO COMMUNITIES  SEE MAPS   TREATMENTS ARE DESIGNED TO REDUCE THE THREAT OF CATASTROPHIC WILDFIRE, PROTECT LIFE AND PROPERTY, AND IMPROVE FOREST HEALTH, RESULTING IN FORESTS THAT ARE MORE RESILIENT TO THE EFFECTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE THE CONSERVANCY ELECTS TO USE THE 10   MTDC  DE MINIMUS RATE DUPLICATION OF EFFORT STATEMENT  THIS PROJECT IS NOT AN OVERLAP WITH FUNDING FROM ANOTHER FEDERAL AGENCY

THE BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT, WITH APPROVAL OF THE SECRETARY OF THE DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR, MANAGES THE SOUTHERN NEVADA PUBLIC LAND MANAGEMENT ACT (SNPLMA) PROGRAM IN NEVADA. OF THE REVENUE GENERATED THROUGH THE SNPLMA, AS AMENDED, 85 PERCENT IS DEPOSITED INTO THE SNPLMA SPECIAL ACCOUNT TO FUND SPECIFIED KINDS OF PROJECTS. THE PROJECTS INCLUDE: PARKS, TRAILS, AND NATURAL AREAS THAT BENEFIT CERTAIN CITIES AND COUNTIES IN NEVADA; CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS FOR CERTAIN FEDERALLY-MANAGED AREAS; CONSERVATION INITIATIVES ON FEDERAL LAND IN CERTAIN COUNTIES IN NEVADA; A MULTI-SPECIES HABITAT CONSERVATION PLAN; ENVIRONMENTALLY SENSITIVE LAND ACQUISITIONS; HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION PROJECTS, IMPLEMENTATION OF THE EASTERN NEVADA LANDSCAPE RESTORATION PROJECT; AND THE LAKE TAHOE RESTORATION ACT PROJECTS. THE REMAINING 15 PERCENT IS DISTRIBUTED TO THE STATE OF NEVADA'S GENERAL EDUCATION PROGRAM (5 PERCENT) AND THE SOUTHERN NEVADA WATER AUTHORITY (10 PERCENT) FOR WATER TREATMENT AND TRANSMISSION FACILITY INFRASTRUCTURE IN CLARK COUNTY, NEVADA.
